feature.name: Abelard
feature.origin: Peter; French philosopher, lover of Heloise (1079-1142).

feature.name: Aida
feature.origin: Ethiopian slave, beloved of Egyptian officer Radames in Verdi's opera "Aida" (Italy, 1870).

feature.name: Avtandil
feature.origin: Lover of Tinatin in Shota Rustavely's novel "Knight in tiger-skin" (Georgia, 12th century).

feature.name: Bovary
feature.origin: Romantic heroine of Flaubert's novel "Madame Bovary" (France, 19th century).

feature.name: Casanova
feature.origin: Giovanni; Italian adventurer, lover and author (1725-1798).

feature.name: Catherine
feature.origin: Tragic lover of Heathcliff in Emily Brontë's novel "Wuthering Heights" (England, 1847).

feature.name: Charlois Regio
feature.origin: Auguste Honore Pierre; French astronomer, independent discoverer of Eros (1864-1910).

feature.name: Cupid
feature.origin: Roman god of love, equivalent of Eros.

feature.name: Don Juan
feature.origin: Lover, character of medieval European legend retold in Moliere's "Don Juan" (France, 1665).

feature.name: Don Quixote
feature.origin: Knight-errant, imagined Dulcinea as his lady-love in Cervantes' "Don Quixote" (Spain, 1605).

feature.name: Dulcinea
feature.origin: Imaginary lady-love of the knight Don Quixote in Cervantes' "Don Quixote" (Spain, 1605).

feature.name: Eurydice
feature.origin: In Greek mythology, wife of singer Orpheus, who fails to bring her from Hades.

feature.name: Finsen Dorsum
feature.origin: William S.; South African astronomer, detected Eros' elongated shape (1905-1979).

feature.name: Fujitsubo
feature.origin: Lover of Genji in "The Tale of Genji" by Murasaki Sikibu, first modern novel (Japan, c.1000).

feature.name: Galatea
feature.origin: Woman in Greek mythology, brought to life from statue by Pygmalion, legendary king of Cyprus.

feature.name: Gamba
feature.origin: Marina; companion of astronomer Galileo Galilei (Italy, 17th century).

feature.name: Genji
feature.origin: Prince, lover of Fujitsubo in "The Tale of Genji" by Murasaki Sikibu (Japan, c.1000).

feature.name: Heathcliff
feature.origin: Tragic lover of Catherine in Emily Brontë's novel "Wuthering Heights" (England, 1847).

feature.name: Himeros
feature.origin: Attendant of Eros; personification of the longing of love in Greek mythology.

feature.name: Hinks Dorsum
feature.origin: Arthur Robert; English astronomer, first used Eros for solar parallax (1873-1945).

feature.name: Hios
feature.origin: Love child of Poseidon and Hiona in Greek mythology; also island (Chios) in the Aegean Sea.

feature.name: Jahan
feature.origin: Shah; Mogul emperor, built Taj Mahal in Agra, India for wife Mumtaz Mahal (1592-1666).

feature.name: Kastytis
feature.origin: Lithuanian blacksmith, lover of sea goddess Jurate; taken by her to the sea floor.

feature.name: Leander
feature.origin: Lover of Hero, swam to her across Hellespont every night and drowned; in despair, Hero drowned herself.

feature.name: Leylie
feature.origin: Majnoon's lover in "Leylie and Majnoon" poems by Jami and Navoi (Khorasan, 1480s).

feature.name: Lolita
feature.origin: Young girl from V. Nabokov's novel "Lolita" (USA, 1955).

feature.name: Mahal
feature.origin: Mumtaz; Mogul empress; favorite wife of Shah Jahan, who built Taj Mahal (1592-1631).

feature.name: Majnoon
feature.origin: Leylie's lover in "Leylie and Majnoon" poems by Jami and Navoi (Khorasan, 1480s).

feature.name: Mélisande
feature.origin: Wife of Prince Golaud and lover of his half-brother, Pelléas, in Maeterlinck drama (Belgium, 1892).

feature.name: Narcissus
feature.origin: Young man from Greek mythology who fell in love with his own reflection in water.

feature.name: Orpheus
feature.origin: Singer and musician in Greek mythology; fails to bring his love Eurydice from Hades.

feature.name: Pao-yü
feature.origin: Lover of Tai-yü in novel by Ts'ao Chan (China, 18th century; also "Dream of the Red Chamber", 1929).

feature.name: Pelléas
feature.origin: Beloved of Mélisande in Maeterlinck drama and later musical works by Faure, Debussy and Schoenberg.

feature.name: Psyche
feature.origin: Beloved of Eros; personification of human soul in Greek mythology.

feature.name: Pygmalion
feature.origin: King of Cyprus; carved statue of woman brought to life as Galatea, whom he married.

feature.name: Radames
feature.origin: Egyptian officer, beloved of Ethiopian slave Aida in Verdi's opera "Aida" (Italy, 1870).

feature.name: Selene
feature.origin: Moon goddess in Greek mythology, lover of Endymion.

feature.name: Tai-yü
feature.origin: Beloved by Pao-yü in novel by Ts'ao Chan (China, 18th century; also "Dream of the Red Chamber", 1929).

feature.name: Tutanekai
feature.origin: Māori hero, beloved of young maiden Hinemoa who swam across Lake Rotorua to marry him.

feature.name: Valentine
feature.origin: St. Valentine's day (principally Roman) for all lovers.

feature.name: Witt Regio
feature.origin: Carl Gustav; German astronomer, first discoverer of Eros (1866-1946).
